name: Moroccan Jewish Tanzeya
description: This spiced chutney made with dried fruit like prunes, apricots, figs and raisins comes from Leetal and Ron Arazi, owners of New York Shuk, a food company specializing in Sephardic and Middle Eastern Jewish cuisines. It's delicious served with chicken, beef or lamb, like the Arazis' lamb shanks with caramelized onions.
keywords: dried apricots, dried figs, prune, fall

recipeInstructions.text: In a wide, shallow saucepan, combine prunes, apricots, figs and raisins. Add 2 cups hot water, and allow to rest for 15 minutes.

Add sugar and remaining ingredients. Place over high heat and bring to a boil. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, until water has almost completely evaporated, 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Discard cinnamon stick and cardamom pod. Allow mixture to cool; if desired, it may be covered and refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.
